entries.meaning: (US, historical) The position or office of a patroon; landownership (originally of a Dutch colony).
examples: His patroonship of Rensellaerwick lay immediately below Fort Aurania, and extended for several miles on each side of the Hudson, beside embracing the mountainous region of the Helderberg.

entries.meaning: (US, historical) An estate run by a patroon, or under a similar system. [from 19th c.]
